rpg_map package

Module contents

class rpg_map.Map(bytes, width, height, grid_size, map_type=Ellipsis, unlocked=Ellipsis, special_points=Ellipsis, obstacles=Ellipsis)

Bases: object

static draw_background(bytes, background)

Draws the background image at every transparent pixel if the background is set

draw_path(travel, percentage, line_width, path_type=Ellipsis, display_style=Ellipsis, progress_display_type=Ellipsis)

Draws a path from a travel struct onto the map with the specified style and percentage of the path drawn.

full_image()

Returns the full map

get_bits()
height
masked_image()

Returns the full map with a mask applied

unlock_point_from_coordinates(x, y)

Takes in a coordinate, if it is close to an “unlocked” grid point it will unlock it and return true, if the point is already unlocked it will return false

unlocked
width
with_dot(x, y, color, radius)

Adds a dot do be drawn on the map when full_image or masked_image is called

with_grid()

Signal you want a grid to be drawn on the map as well

with_obstacles()

Signal you want obstacles to be drawn on the map as well

class rpg_map.Travel(map, current_location, destination)

Bases: object

static dbg_map(map)

Displays the map in a black and white view where white are the obstacles and black are the free spaces. This is to debug if a fault is with the pathfinding algorithm or the map reduction algorithm.
